title: Passwordless Login
description: Log in without entering a password.
help: Allow users to log in without entering a password by using passkeys or emailing them a secure, instant login link instead.

group.title: Enable Passwordless Login
group.description: Allow users to log in without entering a password by using passkeys or emailing them a secure, instant login link instead.

2fa_bypass_group.title: Allow Two-Factor Bypass for Passwordless Login
2fa_bypass_group.description: Add an option to bypass two-factor authentication when using passwordless login in the WordPress user profile.

methods.title: Available Authentication Methods
methods.description: Solid Security supports multiple passwordless login methods.

availability.title: Per-User Availability
availability.description: By default, all users selected above will be able to use passwordless login. Change to “Disabled” if you prefer to have users opt-in themselves.

oneOf.title: Method First
oneOf.description: Choose between the traditional and passwordless login methods before entering a username or email address.

oneOf.title: Username First
oneOf.description: Enter the username or email address first before selecting the login method.

passkey_user_verification.title: Passkey User Verification
passkey_user_verification.description: User Verification is an additional authentication step for using passkeys. For example, a PIN or biometric authentication might be required. By default, Solid Security asks your browser to determine the verification steps to apply. However, you can make this additional user verification mandatory by selecting “Required” here. User verification is not yet supported on all browsers, including Mozilla Firefox on MacOS.

ui:enumDescriptions: Email users a Magic Link they can use to log in with one click.
Users can log in with biometrics like Face ID, Touch ID, Windows Hello, or any passkey their device supports.
